channel.title: VPS Hard Problem!
channel.description:
Hello, I got a hard problem to fix
Can someone fix this VPS problem? When I type my VPS ip at Remote Desktop Connection it says this: How I fix?
[IMG]http://i46.tinypic.com/ibmdfn.png[/img]

item.title: VPS Hard Problem!
item.dc:creator: @Gillare Gillare
item.description:
@Gillare wrote:

I tried to connect via Putty before Gnome.
Don’t understand really about that Gnome…

Read full topic

item.title: VPS Hard Problem!
item.dc:creator: @joelandjacob joelandjacob
item.description:
@joelandjacob wrote:

Erm, I don’t believe RDC has the ability to connect to a vps. Mainly because RDC is Windows and Linux is well… Linux…

Anyways, try installing GNOME 3 via Terminal on your vps.


Insert the drive (any data it contains will be erased!)
Run dmesg in a terminal: this will give you the location of the stick in square brackets, such as sdb
To write the image, run sudo dd if=GNOME-3.4.iso of=/dev/DRIVE bs=8M conv=fsync, replacing DRIVE with the location
Once the write operation has finished, you can reboot with the USB drive inserted (you may have to specify the boot device on startup)

Source(s): http://www.gnome.org/getting-gnome/

Once you have done that, you can then connect with Putty.

Read full topic
